pageTitle: 2008 saw a drop in violence for Washington’s troops | FOB Tacoma - The News Tribune
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {20681=Iraq still remains the deadliest combat zone for Washington-based service members, though the number of fatalities has dropped since their apex in 2006. One likely reason for this is that the majority of deployed soldiers from Fort Lewis have served in Iraq. This year, though, was the deadliest in Afghanistan for Washington troops, defined as a service member who is stationed at a military installation in the state or lists Washington as his or her home state., 23747=2008, 32541=Matt Misterek has supervised military coverage at The News Tribune since 2003. textBeforeTable: Here is a breakdown of Washington service member deaths, both combat- and non-combat-related, in Iraq and Afghanistan since 2001: Iraq still remains the deadliest combat zone for Washington-based service members, though the number of fatalities has dropped since their apex in 2006. One likely reason for this is that the majority of deployed soldiers from Fort Lewis have served in Iraq. This year, though, was the deadliest in Afghanistan for Washington troops, defined as a service member who is stationed at a military installation in the state or lists Washington as his or her home state. December 31, 2008 4:12 pm Post by Scott Fontaine on Dec. 31, 2008 at 4:12 pm with No Comments »
